fields.name: SRC
fields.description: Clock source

fields.name: SRC
fields.description: Clock source

fields.name: BYPASS
fields.description: Enable or disable bypass of LFCLK crystal oscillator with external clock source

enumeratedValues.name: Disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Disable (use with Xtal or low-swing external source)

fields.name: EXTERNAL
fields.description: Enable or disable external source for LFCLK

enumeratedValues.name: Enabled
enumeratedValues.description: Enable use of external source instead of Xtal (SRC needs to be set to Xtal)

registers.name: HFXODEBOUNCE
registers.description: HFXO debounce time. The HFXO is started by triggering the TASKS_HFCLKSTART task.

fields.name: HFXODEBOUNCE
fields.description: HFXO debounce time. Debounce time = HFXODEBOUNCE * 16 us.

enumeratedValues.name: Db256us
enumeratedValues.description: 256 us debounce time. Recommended for TSX-3225, FA-20H and FA-128 crystals.

enumeratedValues.name: Db1024us
enumeratedValues.description: 1024 us debounce time. Recommended for NX1612AA and NX1210AB crystals.

fields.name: CTIV
fields.description: Calibration timer interval in multiple of 0.25 seconds. Range: 0.25 seconds to 31.75 seconds.

registers.name: TRACECONFIG
registers.description: Clocking options for the trace port debug interface

fields.name: TRACEPORTSPEED
fields.description: Speed of trace port clock. Note that the TRACECLK pin will output this clock divided by two.

fields.name: TRACEMUX
fields.description: Pin multiplexing of trace signals. See pin assignment chapter for more details.

enumeratedValues.name: GPIO
enumeratedValues.description: No trace signals routed to pins. All pins can be used as regular GPIOs.

enumeratedValues.name: Serial
enumeratedValues.description: SWO trace signal routed to pin. Remaining pins can be used as regular GPIOs.

enumeratedValues.name: Parallel
enumeratedValues.description: All trace signals (TRACECLK and TRACEDATA[n]) routed to pins.

fields.name: TASKS_LOWPWR
fields.description: Enable Low-power mode (variable latency)

fields.name: OUTPUTRDY
fields.description: USB supply output settling time elapsed

enumeratedValues.name: NotReady
enumeratedValues.description: USBREG output settling time not elapsed

enumeratedValues.name: Ready
enumeratedValues.description: USBREG output settling time elapsed (same information as USBPWRRDY event)

fields.name: SYSTEMOFF
fields.description: Enable System OFF mode

fields.name: POF
fields.description: Enable or disable power failure warning

fields.name: THRESHOLD
fields.description: Power-fail comparator threshold setting. This setting applies both for normal voltage mode (supply connected to both VDD and VDDH) and high voltage mode (supply connected to VDDH only). Values 0-3 set threshold below 1.7 V and should not be used as brown out detection will be activated before power failure warning on such low voltages.

fields.name: THRESHOLDVDDH
fields.description: Power-fail comparator threshold setting for high voltage mode (supply connected to VDDH only). This setting does not apply for normal voltage mode (supply connected to both VDD and VDDH).

fields.name: GPREGRET
fields.description: General purpose retention register

fields.name: GPREGRET
fields.description: General purpose retention register

register.name: RXDELAY
register.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO

fields.name: RXDELAY
fields.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO. The value specifies the number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns) delay from the the sampling edge of SCK (leading edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 0, trailing edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 1) until the input serial data is sampled. As en example, if RXDELAY = 0 and CONFIG.CPHA = 0, the input serial data is sampled on the rising edge of SCK.

fields.name: SLEEPSTATE

Reflects the sleep state during automatic collision resolution. Set to IDLE

        GOSLEEP task.

enumeratedValues.description: CRC is not expected in RX frames

enumeratedValues.description: Last 16 bits in RX frame is CRC, CRC is checked and CRCSTATUS updated

fields.description: Number of complete bytes received in the frame (including CRC, but excluding parity and SoF/EoF framing)

registers.name: CONFIG[%s]
registers.description: Description collection: Configuration for OUT[n], SET[n], and CLR[n] tasks and IN[n] event

fields.name: MODE
fields.description: Mode

enumeratedValues.name: Disabled
enumeratedValues.description: Disabled. Pin specified by PSEL will not be acquired by the GPIOTE module.

fields.name: PSEL
fields.description: GPIO number associated with SET[n], CLR[n], and OUT[n] tasks and IN[n] event

fields.name: PORT
fields.description: Port number

fields.name: POLARITY
fields.description: When In task mode: Operation to be performed on output when OUT[n] task is triggered. When In event mode: Operation on input that shall trigger IN[n] event.

enumeratedValues.name: None
enumeratedValues.description: Task mode: No effect on pin from OUT[n] task. Event mode: no IN[n] event generated on pin activity.

enumeratedValues.name: LoToHi
enumeratedValues.description: Task mode: Set pin from OUT[n] task. Event mode: Generate IN[n] event when rising edge on pin.

enumeratedValues.name: HiToLo
enumeratedValues.description: Task mode: Clear pin from OUT[n] task. Event mode: Generate IN[n] event when falling edge on pin.

enumeratedValues.name: Toggle
enumeratedValues.description: Task mode: Toggle pin from OUT[n]. Event mode: Generate IN[n] when any change on pin.

fields.name: OUTINIT
fields.description: When in task mode: Initial value of the output when the GPIOTE channel is configured. When in event mode: No effect.

enumeratedValues.name: Low
enumeratedValues.description: Task mode: Initial value of pin before task triggering is low

enumeratedValues.name: High
enumeratedValues.description: Task mode: Initial value of pin before task triggering is high

fields.name: EDGE
fields.description: Defines on which PDM_CLK edge left (or mono) is sampled

enumeratedValues.name: LeftFalling
enumeratedValues.description: Left (or mono) is sampled on falling edge of PDM_CLK

enumeratedValues.name: LeftRising
enumeratedValues.description: Left (or mono) is sampled on rising edge of PDM_CLK

fields.name: GAINL
fields.description: Left output gain adjustment, in 0.5 dB steps, around the default module gain (see electrical parameters) 0x00    -20 dB gain adjust 0x01  -19.5 dB gain adjust (...) 0x27   -0.5 dB gain adjust 0x28      0 dB gain adjust 0x29   +0.5 dB gain adjust (...) 0x4F  +19.5 dB gain adjust 0x50    +20 dB gain adjust

fields.name: GAINR
fields.description: Right output gain adjustment, in 0.5 dB steps, around the default module gain (see electrical parameters)

registers.name: EVENTS_RXPTRUPD
registers.description:
The RXD.PTR register has been copied to internal double-buffers.
      When the I2S module is started and RX is enabled, this event will be generated for every RXTXD.MAXCNT words that are received on the SDIN pin.

fields.name: EVENTS_RXPTRUPD
fields.description:
The RXD.PTR register has been copied to internal double-buffers.
      When the I2S module is started and RX is enabled, this event will be generated for every RXTXD.MAXCNT words that are received on the SDIN pin.

fields.name: EVENTS_STOPPED
fields.description: I2S transfer stopped.

registers.name: EVENTS_TXPTRUPD
registers.description:
The TDX.PTR register has been copied to internal double-buffers.
      When the I2S module is started and TX is enabled, this event will be generated for every RXTXD.MAXCNT words that are sent on the SDOUT pin.

fields.name: EVENTS_TXPTRUPD
fields.description:
The TDX.PTR register has been copied to internal double-buffers.
      When the I2S module is started and TX is enabled, this event will be generated for every RXTXD.MAXCNT words that are sent on the SDOUT pin.

enumeratedValues.name: K_DR

registers.name: HOST_IOT_KPRTL_LOCK
registers.description: This write-once register is the K_PRTL lock register. When this register is set, K_PRTL cannot be used and a zeroed key will be used instead. The value of this register is saved in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain.

fields.name: HOST_IOT_KPRTL_LOCK
fields.description: This register is the K_PRTL lock register. When this register is set, K_PRTL cannot be used and a zeroed key will be used instead. The value of this register is saved in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain.

enumeratedValues.name: Disabled
enumeratedValues.description: K_PRTL can be selected for use from register HOST_CRYPTOKEY_SEL

enumeratedValues.name: Enabled
enumeratedValues.description: K_PRTL has been locked until next power-on reset (POR). If K_PRTL is selected anyway, a zeroed key will be used instead.

registers.name: HOST_IOT_KDR0
registers.description: This register holds bits 31:0 of K_DR. The value of this register is saved in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain. Reading from this address returns the K_DR valid status indicating if K_DR is successfully retained.

fields.name: HOST_IOT_KDR0
fields.description: Write: K_DR bits 31:0. Read: 0x00000000 when 128-bit K_DR key value is not yet retained in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain. Read: 0x00000001 when 128-bit K_DR key value is successfully retained in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain.

registers.name: HOST_IOT_KDR1

fields.name: HOST_IOT_KDR1
fields.description: K_DR bits 63:32

enumeratedValues.name: Valid
